personalInfo.name: Amin Yosoh
personalInfo.title: Senior UX / Product Designer
personalInfo.summary: Senior UX designer turning complex B2B and healthcare problems into clear flows, systems, and UI. 8+ years across IoT, healthcare, e‑commerce, internal tools, and enterprise portals.

adjacent: SaaS-like platforms (Modity reporting, Alfa Laval portal)

highlights: Worked on highly complex systems combining both hardware and software products.
Integrated user research and usability testing as a natural part of the design process.
Established a repeatable research & usability flow/template now used broadly in team processes.
Brought structure and clarity into a messy, fast-moving environment, improving cross-functional collaboration.
experiences.impact: Created scalable research/testing practices and delivered clarity in multi‑platform system design.

highlights: Consulting engagement supporting Axis product teams with research, prototyping, and system patterns.
experiences.impact: Reinforced design operations and discovery-to-delivery cadence.

highlights: Led UX/UI for internal and external services across mobile and web.
Introduced structured usability testing practices integrated into team workflows.
Contributed to motion design and brand/illustration assets to ensure coherent identity.
Created clarity in a diverse, fast-moving environment by defining repeatable design processes.
experiences.impact: Built scalable design practices and improved product consistency across multiple services.

highlights: Led UX/UI for d.CARE platform, improving engagement for renal patients across 23 countries.
Managed three parallel projects while maintaining consistency and clear priorities.
Integrated research and usability testing with remote-first validation through clinicians and patients.
Transformed diffuse and sometimes conflicting requirements into clear, implementable designs.
Ensured accessibility for elderly patients via typography, contrast, and interaction decisions.
experiences.impact: Balanced multiple high-stakes projects while keeping clarity and consistency; established remote-first UX practices.

highlights: Designed the complete digital rental journey including customer booking flows and staff tools from scratch.
Moved directly into hi‑fi prototyping to accelerate alignment under tight deadlines.
Created a hybrid design system during an ongoing rebrand to maintain visual consistency.
Delivered developer‑ready assets with clear states and flows.
experiences.impact: Launched 'Rent at Clas' across Sweden, Norway, and Finland using nearly all delivered designs.

highlights: Improved e‑commerce UX via heuristic evaluation and targeted high‑fidelity concepts.
Designed a customer portal PoC centralizing documentation, service booking, and support.
experiences.impact: Portal concept adopted into production pipeline; set foundation for scalable customer portal.

highlights: Designed reporting feature turning complex energy trading data into actionable portfolio insights.
Ran user feedback and iterated on modular reports with monthly/yearly breakdowns.
experiences.impact: Reporting shipped; customers could reconcile invoices faster and self‑serve analysis.

highlights: Holistic UX across hardware, app, and web for an IoT ecosystem.
Integrated new graphic profile; contributed illustration and motion assets.
experiences.impact: Cohesive cross‑platform experience matching the updated brand profile.

projects.title: Engaging health tracking
evidence: Designed a fluid intake tracker with streaks and daily tips to make logging habitual.
Nurse‑facilitated remote feedback validated flows during pandemic constraints.
projects.impact: Launched with rebrand; described as 'fun, useful, super' and influenced other patterns.

projects.title: Smarter customer portal
evidence: PoC for documentation, service booking, and support; centralized flows adopted into pipeline.

projects.title: Tool rentals made digital
evidence: End‑to‑end customer + staff flows; launched in SE/NO/FI using nearly all delivered designs.

projects.title: Simplifying energy reports
evidence: Modular portfolio reports with monthly/yearly breakdowns; improved reconciliation vs invoices.
